key_problems.text: Interested in surgical weight loss via the gastric bypass as opposed to Lap-Band.

pertinent_history.text: Overweight for over 20 years and wants to have more energy and improve her self-image.
Has tried numerous commercial weight loss programs including Weight Watcher's, RS, Slim Fast, an exercise program, Atkin's Diet, and Dexatrim.
Lost 100 pounds on Redux for nine months but regained the weight within a year.

objective_findings.text: Pleasant female in no acute distress. Alert and oriented x 3.
HEENT: Normocephalic, atraumatic. Extraocular muscles intact, nonicteric sclerae.
Chest is clear to auscultation bilaterally.
Abdomen is obese, soft, nontender and nondistended. Extremities show no edema, clubbing or cyanosis.

assessment.text: 34-year-old female with a BMI of 43 who is interested in surgical weight via the gastric bypass as opposed to Lap-Band.
Will be asking for a letter of medical necessity from Dr. XYZ.
She will also see my nutritionist and social worker and have an upper endoscopy.
Once this is completed, we will submit her to her insurance company for approval.
